items.author: F. X. Feeney
items.content: One of the best films of the year thus far.

items.author: Peter Stack
items.content: Heart and tenderness are rare in cartoon movies. But in an age of frenetic children's fare, the new animated adventure The Iron Giant dares to show a lot of both, and it comes up a winner.

items.author: Mary Elizabeth Williams
items.content: Surprising as it sounds, as far as examinations of trust, loyalty and identity go, the big metal dude's story winds up far more satisfying than the plodding Kubrick opus any day of the week.

items.author: Mark Caro
items.content: An animated tale equipped with heart, humor, blazing action and not a sappy song in earshot.

items.author: Lawrence Toppman
items.content: Keeps its sense of humor while dealing with serious issues.

items.author: Stephen Hunter
items.content: Still, the movie -- as beautifully drawn, as sleek and engaging as it is -- has the annoyance of incredible smugness.

items.author: Lawrence Van Gelder
items.content: A smooth, skilled example of animated filmmaking.

items.author: Paula Nechak
items.content: More intelligent and thought-provoking than the usual dumb and dull-witted fare for children.

items.author: Susan Wloszczyna
items.content: We are happy to report there is intelligent life in feature animation beyond planet Disney and the gaseous ball of foul language known as South Park.
